intro: Sebastiania trichogyne, commonly known as the red-berried sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its most distinctive feature is the bright red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Sebastiania trichogyne is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
